RetailFlow

Australia's Contemporary Multi-Channel Retailer

Solving customer service crisis with AI

The Situation

Customer satisfaction is at 68% (down from 78%). Email response times are 26 hours. A team of 25 is overwhelmed.

The Solution: A AUD $150,000 AI chatbot pilot project to handle 40% of inquiries, reduce response times to under 2 hours, and prove RetailFlow can innovate with technology.

Your Role: Navigate the challenges. Make decisions. Learn where AI helps and where humans still matter.

RetailFlow Company Profile

Meet the team. Understand the business. Learn the challenges.

About RetailFlow

The Business

RetailFlow was founded in 2008 during the global financial crisis. Today, it's a mid-sized Australian retail chain with 50 stores across Australia and a thriving e-commerce platform that generates 35% of revenue.

We're known for: contemporary design, customer-first approach, and seamless omnichannel experience (stores + online).

The Challenge

Customer satisfaction is declining: 68% now (down from 78% two years ago)

Service is overwhelmed: 25-person team handles 2,640 inquiries per week. Email response time: 26 hours (unacceptable).

Competition is fierce: Pure online players (ASOS, The Iconic) move faster. Amazon is entering. We need to innovate.

The Chatbot Pilot Project

AUD $150K. 6 Months. High stakes.

Project Overview

AUD $150K
Budget
6 mo
Timeline
Week 2
Current Status
6
Core Team

Objectives

  1. Reduce Response Time: From 26 hours to <2 hours
  2. Improve Satisfaction: From 68% to 75%
  3. Handle Inquiries: Chatbot resolves 40% independently
  4. Validate AI: Prove technology works for broader roadmap

Interact & Engage

Chat with the bot. Ask the team. Test scenarios.

Try Scenarios

Test your judgment. See how the chatbot and humans handle different situations.

Simple

Order Tracking

"Hi, where is my order? I ordered last week and haven't received it yet. Order number is RF-2024-08-15743"

What would the chatbot do? Lookup order in database, provide tracking link, confirm delivery estimate. 100% resolved. No escalation needed.

What would a human do? Same + personalization ("I see you also bought bedding last month—how's that working out?")

Moderate

Return Request - Outside Policy

"I want to return a sofa I bought 45 days ago. It's been used but I just decided I don't like it in my space. Can I get a refund?"

What would the chatbot do? Check policy: 30-day return window. Flag: Outside window. Escalate to human for judgment call.

What would a human do? Understand customer situation, decide if exception justified, possibly offer store credit or discount instead of full refund.

Complex

Angry Customer - Service Recovery

"I'm incredibly disappointed! I've been a loyal customer for 6 years. I ordered a dress for an important event on Aug 10, was promised Aug 15 delivery, but didn't get it until Aug 22. I MISSED THE EVENT. I want compensation and I'm considering taking my business elsewhere!"

What would the chatbot do? Recognize emotional escalation. Acknowledge issue. Apologize. Escalate immediately to human for service recovery.

What would a human do? Genuine apology. Recognize 6-year loyalty. Offer meaningful compensation (store credit + refund). Investigate delivery failure. Rebuild relationship.

Chat with RetailBot

Your chatbot will be embedded here. Try queries like:

  • "Where is my order RF-2024-08-14527?"
  • "Do you have this in size 12?"
  • "What's your return policy?"
  • "My delivery is late, what can I do?"

About This Simulation

Understanding RetailFlow and how to learn from it.

What Is RetailFlow?

RetailFlow is a fictional retail company created to teach AI project management through immersive simulation.

You are not reading a real company website. You're engaging with an educational tool that uses storytelling, character development, and realistic scenarios to teach decision-making frameworks.

The Scenario

RetailFlow is an Australian mid-sized retail chain facing a critical customer service crisis:

  • Customer satisfaction is declining: 68% (down from 78%)
  • Response times are unacceptable: 26 hours for email
  • The solution: A AUD $150K AI chatbot pilot project
  • The challenge: Navigating organizational complexity and uncertainty

Learning Outcomes

By engaging with RetailFlow, you'll develop:

Strategic Thinking
How to frame AI initiatives within business context
Org Dynamics
Stakeholder management and competing interests
Tech Judgment
What AI can and cannot do
Decision-Making
Choosing with incomplete information

How to Use This Simulation

  1. Explore with Purpose – Navigate pages intentionally, learning the business context
  2. Read Employee Profiles – Understand different perspectives and motivations
  3. Engage with Scenarios – Practice thinking about complex situations
  4. Ask the Virtual Team – Interact with AI-powered bots for different perspectives
  5. Access Full Documents – Deep-dive when you need more detail
  6. Draw Insights – Reflect on what you've learned and what you'd do differently

What This Simulation IS

  • ✅ A realistic business scenario for learning
  • ✅ A tool for developing decision-making frameworks
  • ✅ A way to explore organizational complexity
  • ✅ Practice with competing perspectives and interests

What This Simulation IS NOT

  • ❌ A real company or business opportunity
  • ❌ A strategy guide for your actual organization
  • ❌ A complete or perfect representation of reality
  • ❌ Prescriptive—there's no single "right answer"

For Educators

If you're using RetailFlow in a course:

  • You can use it as-is, modify it for your context, or build on it
  • Use scenarios as discussion starters
  • Have participants make specific recommendations
  • Encourage debate about different approaches
  • Connect simulation to real-world examples
  • Debrief after key exploration phases

Ready to explore?

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about RetailFlow and how to use it.

General Questions

Is RetailFlow a real company?

No. RetailFlow is entirely fictional and created for educational purposes. It does not operate any actual retail stores, services, or business activities.

Can I purchase products from RetailFlow?

No. RetailFlow does not sell products or services. There are no real stores, no online shopping capability, and no customer service to contact. This is purely an educational simulation.

Are the employees real people?

No. All employees are fictional characters created for the simulation. Their backgrounds, personalities, and perspectives are entirely made up to create a realistic organizational environment for learning.

Can I contact the people listed on this site?

No. The email addresses, phone numbers, and offices listed do not exist. If you have questions about this simulation, please contact your course coordinator instead.

About the Simulation

What's the purpose of this simulation?

RetailFlow teaches:

  • AI project management
  • Organizational dynamics
  • Decision-making under uncertainty
  • Stakeholder management
  • Understanding AI capabilities and limitations

How long should I spend on this?

Quick overview: 30 minutes | Thorough: 2-3 hours | Deep dive: 4-6 hours

Your course coordinator may specify recommended time.

What if I don't understand something?

Try reviewing the relevant page, reading employee profiles, checking documents, or asking the chatbots. If still unclear, contact your course coordinator.

About the Chatbots

Are the chatbots real AI?

Partially. They're powered by real AI language models, which means they can have natural conversations but are also unpredictable and can make mistakes. Treat them as learning tools, not information sources.

Can I trust what the chatbots tell me?

No. Use them to explore perspectives and generate questions, but don't rely on them for factual information. They may provide inaccurate information or be inconsistent.

What if a chatbot says something inappropriate?

Report it to your course coordinator immediately. Include what you asked and what response you received. This helps us improve the experience.

Scenarios & Decision-Making

What's the "right" answer to scenarios?

There isn't one. Each scenario presents tradeoffs. The point is to think through them, not reach a predetermined answer. Better questions: "What would you prioritize and why?" and "What are the consequences?"

Why do some employees disagree?

Because real organizations have genuine conflicts of interest. Emma wants innovation, David wants financial discipline, Sarah protects operations, Marcus focuses on technology. These tensions are realistic and productive.

Learning & Reflection

What questions should I ask myself?

  • Do I understand this organization and why people think the way they do?
  • How would I feel if I were [employee name]?
  • What's being optimized for and what's being sacrificed?
  • Where could this go wrong?
  • What would I do differently and why?
  • Why isn't there a simple answer?
  • How does this relate to my experience?

Can I use this for my own project work?

Yes, with important caveats. The frameworks are valuable for learning, but this is one possible scenario. Real situations are more complex and context-dependent. Use RetailFlow to build intuition, then adapt to your context.

More questions? Check the Legal Disclaimer or contact your course coordinator.

Legal Disclaimer & About This Simulation

Important information about RetailFlow

Educational Disclaimer

IMPORTANT NOTICE: RetailFlow is a fictional company created solely for educational purposes. This website is used as a teaching tool for AI project management, organizational dynamics, decision-making under uncertainty, and understanding AI capabilities and limitations in business contexts.

Fictional Nature

  • All company information, services, products, and claims are entirely fictional
  • All employees, executives, and testimonials are fictitious characters
  • Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, or actual companies is purely coincidental
  • All offices, stores, and contact information do not exist
  • This is NOT a real retail company

AI-Generated Content Disclosure

Significant portions of this website were generated with assistance from:

  • Claude (Anthropic) – Primary content generation
  • ChatGPT (OpenAI) – Additional content creation
  • GitHub Copilot – Code suggestions

Chatbot Disclaimer

The virtual employee bots on this site:

  • Are powered by AI language models
  • May generate unpredictable or incorrect responses
  • Do not represent real people or company positions
  • Should not be relied upon for factual information

If you encounter concerning content, report it to your course coordinator.

Limitations & Disclaimers

This educational simulation:

  • Does NOT replace real business consulting or expertise
  • Is designed for LEARNING, not real business decisions
  • Contains entirely fictional data, metrics, and scenarios
  • Means to teach principles, not provide tactical guidance

Privacy & Data Collection

No personal data is intentionally collected through this website. No cookies are used for tracking. As this site is hosted on GitHub Pages, GitHub may collect basic analytics and IP addresses. Refer to GitHub's Privacy Policy for details.
